ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: but the Great Blast seized hold of them in the morning,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: But they were seized by the mighty blast towards the morning;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Then the Blast caught them in the morning
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: An explosion struck them in the morning.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: So the scream overcame them at morning.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: But the Sayhah (torment - awful cry) overtook them in the early morning.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: So the rumbling overtook them in the morning;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: and the Cry seized them in the morning;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: But the (Awful) Cry overtook them at the morning hour,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: the blast overtook them early one morning.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Then the shout took hold of them in the early morn.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: So the Cry seized them at dawn,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: But the (mighty) Blast seized them of a morning,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: But As-Saihah (torment - awful cry etc.) overtook them in the early morning (of the fourth day of their promised punishment days).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: But the Shout seized them in the morning,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: But the Blast struck them in the morning.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: But the shriek seized them at early morning.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [15:83] But the Cry seized them in the morning.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (But the (Awful) Cry overtook them) as a chastisement (at the morning hour) in the morning,
